title: Ticket #2365: the switchboard fails
description:
Hi Dan,

I am running into problems with the pre-release build you gave me. condor_root_switchboard seems to be broken. The first problem is that it only accepts the uid, not the username that is specified in the privsep_config. The second problem is that it doesn't seem to understand the valid-dirs list.

My config: 

valid-caller-uids = tony_xen_factory
valid-caller-gids = tony_xen_factory
valid-target-uids = tony_xen_cms_frontend
valid-target-gids = tony_xen_cms_frontend
valid-dirs = /opt/glideinwms-prod/client-logs
valid-dirs = /opt/glideinwms-prod/client-proxies
procd-executable = /opt/glideinwms-prod/condor-wms/sbin/condor_procd

example command: 

   /opt/glideinwms-prod/condor-wms/bin/../sbin/condor_root_switchboard  mkdir 0 2

stdin (1): 

   user-uid=tony_xen_cms_frontend\n

as soon as it encounters the new line it spits out the following error: 

   option 'user-uid' has an invalid uid in file: <stdin>:1

stdin (2): (changed the user-uid to the numeric uid) user-uid=4718 user-dir=/opt/glideinwms-prod/client-logs

As soon as EOF is hit, the following error occurs: 

   directory is not in list of valid dirs

I cannot set up glideinWMS with condor 7.7.1 right now because of this. All the commands work with condor 7.6.1.
remarks:
2011-Aug-10 15:29:08 by zmiller:
a bug in switchboard.unix.cpp causes the switchboard to always fail if the user-uid is specified as a username (e.g. "zmiller") instead of an integer (e.g. 24842).

it's a one character fix to change the call site of safe_strto_id() to safe_strto_uid(). there are no other call sites for safe_strto_id(). checkin will follow.

2011-Aug-10 15:50:02 by zmiller:
after some more investigation, it turns out this is a regression (although never released)... usernames did used to work until we changed the code to use the new safe_strto_uid functions.
check_ins: 2011-Aug-10 16:45   Check-in [26730]: fixed a problem in the condor_root_switchboard that was introduced when changing parse_uid() calls to safe_strto_uid() calls. this was never released, so no version history is required. (#2365) (By Zach Miller )
